intro: Tephroseris ovirensis subsp. gaudinii, commonly known as the Guadini's tephroseris, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous or forested areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive, finely toothed margin. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
